com.reveldigital.player.api

Interface Controller


  • public interface Controller
    The Controller is the primary interface into the player engine. It is accessible from script via the Controller global variable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOnBeaconListener(OnBeaconListener listener)
      Adds a beacon listener interface to receive beacon enter/exit events.
      void addOnCommandListener(OnCommandListener listener)
      Adds a command listener interface to receive service and user command events.
      void addOnImpressionListener(OnImpressionListener listener)
      Adds the on impression listener.
      void addOnMotionListener(OnMotionListener listener)
      Adds a beacon listener interface to receive motion events.
      void addOnPlayedListener(OnPlayedListener listener)
      Adds a played listener interface to receive media played events.
      void addTemplateListener(TemplateListener listener)
      Adds a template listener interface to receive template related events.
      void converse()
      Trigger recording of audio and send result to DialogFlow.

      Returns information related to the device currently running the script.

      Gets the last command issues to the player.

        Current time based on the device time zone.
        Returns:

      • getDeviceTime

        java.util.Date getDeviceTime(java.util.Date date)
        Adjusts the supplied date to the device time zone.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the adjusted date

      • getVersionCode

        int getVersionCode()
        Returns the version of the player app.
        Returns:
        player app version code

      • getDevice

        Device getDevice()
        Returns information related to the device currently running the script.
        Returns:
        the device

      • getTemplate

        Template getTemplate()
        Currently scheduled template. If no template is scheduled this method will return null.
        Returns:
        currently scheduled template or null

      • getSchedule

        Schedule getSchedule()
        Returns the active schedule or null if nothing is scheduled for the current time.
        Returns:
        current schedule or null

      • print

        void print(byte[] data)
        Sends a raw print command to the USB connected printer. Currenly compatible with the MASUNG MS-FPT301
        Parameters:
        print - command data

      • newEventSession

        void newEventSession(java.lang.String id)
        Starts a new event session using the provided id.
        Parameters:
        id - session id

      • newEventSession

        java.lang.String newEventSession()
        Starts a new event session using a generated id.
        Returns:
        a new genrerated session identifier

      • timeEvent

        void timeEvent(java.lang.String eventName)
        Time an event by including the time between this call and a later 'track' call for the same event in the properties sent with the event.
        Parameters:
        eventName - name of the event

      • track

        void track(java.lang.String eventName,
           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties)
        Sends an event to the server to analytics.
        Parameters:
        eventName - name of the event
        properties - a set of properties to include with the event you're sending

      • getLastCommand

        Command getLastCommand()
        Gets the last command issues to the player.
        Returns:
        Controller object with name and argument values

      • converse

        void converse()
        Trigger recording of audio and send result to DialogFlow. Result will present itself as a command named 'dialogflow' with a json argument.

      • sendCommand

        void sendCommand(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String arg)
        Sends a command to the Controller. All registered command listeners will also receive the command.
        Parameters:
        name - command name
        arg - command argument

      • setVolume

        void setVolume(int level)
        Sets the master volume for app. Individual zones may have different volume levels.
        Parameters:
        level - 0 = mute, 100 = max

      • setBrightness

        void setBrightness(int level)
        Sets the screen brightness. Not available on all devices and only on Android M and later.
        Parameters:
        level - 0 = low, 100 = max

      • addTemplateListener

        void addTemplateListener(TemplateListener listener)
        Adds a template listener interface to receive template related events.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener interface to add

      • removeTemplateListener

        void removeTemplateListener(TemplateListener listener)
        Removes a previously added template listener interface.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener interface to remove
